title: Non-Procedural Skill Training for Anesthesiology Trainees: Simulation-Based Preoperative Management of Diabetic Patients

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Anesthesiology Knowledge, Understanding of Diabetes Pathophysiology, and Experience with Preoperative Assessment Procedures
context.additional_context: Training for practicing anesthesiologists to apply non-procedural decision-making skills in real clinical scenarios, featuring hands-on digital simulation-based education

learning_goals: Perform preoperative risk assessments for diabetic patients, including blood glucose control, medication adjustment, and complication prediction, with 80% accuracy
Apply three or more systematic problem-solving strategies in complex clinical scenarios using Gagné’s 9-step instructional model
Manage crisis situations within four stages using team-based communication protocols in a VR simulation environment

resources: Preoperative diabetes patient management VR scenario kit

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
